metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13300 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In FFmpeg 3.2 and 4.0.1, an improper argument (AVCodecParameters) passed tothe avpriv_request_sample function in the handle_eac3 function inlibavformat/movenc.c may trigger an out-of-array read while converting acrafted AVI file to MPEG4, leading to a denial of service and possibly aninformation disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavdevice58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter7 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavformat58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavresample4 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavutil56 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libpostproc55 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libswresample3 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libswscale5 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6').
mythtv package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
gst-libav1.0 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
kino package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
